Firefox places an inline element with position absolute badly on the right border of an parent inline element positioned in relative.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Ctrl+U
2.
3.
Actual Results:  
The absolute positioned element is placed a little outside the parent.

Expected Results:  
The absolute positioned element should be placed exactly on the right border of the parent element like WebKit and IE do.

comments.text:
The padding is a red herring.  What's going on here is that we position the abs pos box before whitespace trimming has happened.  Testcase coming up that demonstrates this clearly.

Fixing bug 255139 might fix this.
